result.execSummary:
The defendant Anita L Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Anita L Krueger in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Counsel verifies receipt of packet from DOC
--no factual corrections

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Case 15CM50, Count #1
The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH

On Case 15CM87:
The Court sentences Defendant to:

All outstanding court costs/obligations are to be converted to civil judgment.

Cases 15CM50 & 15CM87 called at 11:45am [mo]
Defendant Anita L Krueger in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Monica Hall verifies victim rights compliance in both cases.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Case 15CM50 Count #1 and Case 15CM87 Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 of Case 15CM50.
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall
--submits Victim Impact Statement

Sentencing arguments given by Atty. De La Rosa 
Statement made by Mr. Krueger

As to Case 15CM50 Count #1 & Case 15CM87 Count #1:
 The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--the defendant shall undergo any mental health assessment/ counseling as recommended by her supervising agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no direct or indirect contact with: Kevin Adkins, unless approved by the supervising agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--the defendant shall take all of her medications as prescribed by her treating physicians
--the defendant shall not possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--On Case 15CM50 Count #1 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus the $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge 
--On Case 15CM87 Count #1 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge


Case #15CM50: Days credit for time already served:  3  days
Case #15CM87: Days credit for time already served:  0  days

Cases 15CM50 and 15CM87 called at 10:18am [mo]
Defendant Anita L Krueger in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Initial Appearance occured in case  #15CM87:
Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
Ms. Krueger indicates she has a new address, Atty. De La Rosa is to notify the Court of this address in 48 hours. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 

Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant



The Court requires $500 signature bond, with conditions: 
--No direct or indirect contact with Kevin Adkins
--No presence on Carriage Way Drive, Palmyra, with the single EXCEPTION to this is for Ms. Krueger to be at the residence on Carriage Way Drive for a duration of 3-4 hours for purposes of cleaning, so long as it is not a prohibition of any other Court order. Arrangements for this shall be made through a third party, not by Ms. Krueger contacting Mr. Adkins. The Court notes that being at the Carriage Way Drive residence for this period of time shall not be considered a violation of bond in case 15CM50.
--No discussion of the case with Denise Montney 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.


As to case 15CM50:
Atty. De La Rosa requests a Pretrial and STC. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
The State verifies victim rights compliance.

Case called at 1:22 pm [Clerk SH]
[Judge Randy R. Koschnick presiding for BrII]
Defendant Anita L Krueger appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $500 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-No contact with Kevin Adkins  
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
X  EXCEPTION - The Defendant shall be allowed presence at common residence on one occasion to obtain personal belongings if it is done in the presence of law enforcement officer.
-To take all medications as prescribed
